data.lore:
There are warriors who become great for their strength, cunning, or skill with arms. Others simply refuse to die. Urgot, once a great soldier of Noxus, may constitute a case in support of the latter. Prone to diving headlong into enemy battle lines, Urgot sowed chaos throughout the enemy ranks, often sustaining grievous injuries in the process. When his body was unable to weather further abuse, the crippled Urgot was delegated the position of High Executioner of Noxus. By this time, his hands had been ruined and he could barely walk. Scythe-like grafts affixed to his maimed limbs served to carry out his bloody work.

Urgot finally met his end at what should have been his finest hour. Because of his military background, he often accompanied detachments into foreign territory to carry out judgment. After ambushing an enemy force, Jarvan IV, Crown Prince of Demacia, fell into the clutches of Urgot's division. Too far from Noxus to risk transporting their prize for ransom, Urgot prepared to dispose of their captive. At the final moment, however, the Dauntless Vanguard, led by Garen, the Might of Demacia, intervened, and Urgot was cut in two by the zealous warrior as he scrambled to free his Prince. In recognition of his service, the executioner's remains were remanded to the Bleak Academy for reanimation. A lifetime of abuse, however, had left his body in a catastrophic state; proving problematic to the necromancers' craft. Professor Stanwick Pididly, the prevailing scholar of Zaun, offered a solution. Within Pididly's laboratories, a nightmarish new body was forged for Urgot. Now as much machine as man, Urgot arrived at the League of Legends in search of the man who ended his life; necromantic energies coursing through his metal veins.

''We can rebuild him. We have the techmaturgy.''
-- Professor Stanwick Pididly
data.name: Urgot
data.title: the Headsman's Pride

spells.tooltip:
Urgot fires a missile toward the cursor that deals {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) physical damage. If Acid Hunter kills a unit half its mana cost is refunded.

Missile-lock can be achieved by holding the cursor over a target afflicted by Noxian Corrosive Charge.
spells.description: Urgot fires an Acid Hunter missile that collides with the first enemy it hits, slowing the target if he has his Terror Capacitor up. Acid Hunter missile-locks on enemies affected by Noxian Corrosive Charge.
spells.sanitizedTooltip: Urgot fires a missile toward the cursor that deals {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) physical damage. If Acid Hunter kills a unit half its mana cost is refunded. Missile-lock can be achieved by holding the cursor over a target afflicted by Noxian Corrosive Charge.
spells.name: Acid Hunter
spells.sanitizedDescription: Urgot fires an Acid Hunter missile that collides with the first enemy it hits, slowing the target if he has his Terror Capacitor up. Acid Hunter missile-locks on enemies affected by Noxian Corrosive Charge.

spells.tooltip: Urgot charges up his terror capacitor to gain a shield that absorbs {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) damage for 7 seconds. While the shield is active, Urgot's attacks and missiles slow targets by {{ e2 }}%.
spells.description: Urgot charges up his capacitor to gain a shield. While the shield is active, Urgot gains slowing attacks.
spells.sanitizedTooltip: Urgot charges up his terror capacitor to gain a shield that absorbs {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) damage for 7 seconds. While the shield is active, Urgot's attacks and missiles slow targets by {{ e2 }}%.
spells.name: Terror Capacitor
spells.sanitizedDescription: Urgot charges up his capacitor to gain a shield. While the shield is active, Urgot gains slowing attacks.

spells.tooltip:
Urgot launches a Corrosive Charge at a target location. Enemies afflicted by the charge have their Armor reduced by {{ e2 }}% and take {{ e1 }} (+{{ f1 }}) physical damage over {{ e3 }} seconds.

Acid Hunter is able to missile-lock onto targets affected by Noxian Corrosive Charge.
spells.description: Urgot launches a corrosive charge that damages enemies in an area and reduces their Armor.
spells.sanitizedTooltip: Urgot launches a Corrosive Charge at a target location. Enemies afflicted by the charge have their Armor reduced by {{ e2 }}% and take {{ e1 }} (+{{ f1 }}) physical damage over {{ e3 }} seconds. Acid Hunter is able to missile-lock onto targets affected by Noxian Corrosive Charge.
spells.name: Noxian Corrosive Charge
spells.sanitizedDescription: Urgot launches a corrosive charge that damages enemies in an area and reduces their Armor.

spells.tooltip:
Urgot targets an enemy champion and channels his Hyper-Kinetic Position Reverser for 1 second, swapping locations with his target afterward. His target is suppressed for the duration of the channel.

Urgot gains {{ e2 }} Armor and Magic Resist during and after the channel, and his target is slowed by 40% for 3 seconds after being swapped.
spells.description: Urgot charges up his Hyper-Kinetic Position Reverser, swapping positions with the target. His target is suppressed for the duration of the channel. He gains increased Armor and Magic Resist after the swap.
spells.sanitizedTooltip: Urgot targets an enemy champion and channels his Hyper-Kinetic Position Reverser for 1 second, swapping locations with his target afterward. His target is suppressed for the duration of the channel. Urgot gains {{ e2 }} Armor and Magic Resist during and after the channel, and his target is slowed by 40% for 3 seconds after being swapped.
spells.name: Hyper-Kinetic Position Reverser
spells.sanitizedDescription: Urgot charges up his Hyper-Kinetic Position Reverser, swapping positions with the target. His target is suppressed for the duration of the channel. He gains increased Armor and Magic Resist after the swap.

passive.name: Zaun-Touched Bolt Augmenter
passive.description: Urgot's basic attacks and Acid Hunters reduce his targets' damage by 15% for 2.5 seconds.
passive.sanitizedDescription: Urgot's basic attacks and Acid Hunters reduce his targets' damage by 15% for 2.5 seconds.
